definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth

sentences.english: The wedding kiss is the sign of the holy pledge between the bride and the groom.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼上的亲吻标志着新郎新娘间的神圣誓约。

sentences.english: "Only one, " replies the groom. "She won't take it up the arse.
sentences.chinese: “有一个，”新郎回答，“她不喜欢刚交。”

sentences.english: The bridegroom quaffed down a glass of brandy.
sentences.chinese: 新郎将一杯白兰地酒一饮而尽。

sentences.english: At the wedding reception, the bride or groom greet theirs guests.
sentences.chinese: 在姻缘喜宴上，新娘和新郎向宾客表达欢迎。

sentences.english: The voice of bridegroom and bride will never be heard in you again.
sentences.chinese: 新郎和新妇的声音，在你中间决不能再听见。

sentences.english: The groom walks between two rows of guardsmen.
sentences.chinese: “卫兵”们分列两行，向新郎致意。

sentences.english: The next day she noticed her new husband walking sideways like all the other crabs 2, and got upset.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，她又发现她的新郎像其他蟹一样横着走路了。

sentences.english: Gail Hosey, the mother of the groom, answered a knock at the door to find Coker standing in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 新郎的妈妈盖尔弧思打开门时发现寇可站在门前。

sentences.english: The groom wore the white dress uniform of Monaco's Carabinieri royal guard.
sentences.chinese: 新郎身着摩纳哥皇家卫队宪兵白色制服。

sentences.english: However, the fathers of many bridegrooms still require it.
sentences.chinese: 可是，许多新郎的父亲仍然要求女方有陪嫁。

sentences.english: Birkin told him about the race of the bride and the bridegroom.
sentences.chinese: 伯金告诉他说的是刚才新郎新娘赛跑的事。

sentences.english: The bride and groom run to the car under a shower of confetti thrown by the wedding guests.
sentences.chinese: 新娘新郎从客人撒下的彩色纸屑中跑向汽车。

sentences.english: The bride and groom made a lovely couple.
sentences.chinese: 新娘和新郎是天作之合的一对。

sentences.english: He proposed a toast to both the bride and bridegroom.
sentences.chinese: 他提议为新娘和新郎干杯。

sentences.english: Mazel tov to the bride and groom.
Her attendants will also carry flowers and the groom and his attendants will wear boutonnieres.
sentences.chinese: 新郎和他的伴郎则在纽扣孔上插着花。

definition: ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
to worship heaven and earth/ritual kneeling by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/also called 拜堂
(of the groom's family) to send a bridal sedan chair 花轎|花轿 to fetch the bride/to send a party to escort the bride to the groom's house
attendant of the bride or bridegroom at a wedding
disturbing the privacy of bridal room (Chinese custom where guests banter with and play pranks on the newlyweds)
